events.title: Death of Saint Peter
events.description: Saint Peter, one of Jesus's apostles and considered the first Pope by the Catholic Church, is traditionally believed to have been crucified in Rome.
events.significance: Significant in Christian history as a martyr and foundational figure in the establishment of the Church.

events.title: Christopher Columbus Sets Sail
events.description: Christopher Columbus departs from Palos de la Frontera, Spain on his first voyage across the Atlantic Ocean, leading to the European discovery of the Americas.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of sustained European exploration and colonization of the Americas.

events.title: Thomas Edison Demonstrates His Phonograph
events.description: Thomas Edison demonstrates the first successful phonograph, a device capable of recording and reproducing sound.
events.significance: A major milestone in the history of sound recording and playback technology.

events.title: Japan Declares War on India
events.description: During World War II, the Japanese Imperial Army declared war on British India, intensifying conflict in the Southeast Asian theatre.
events.significance: Contributed to the expansion of hostilities in World War II involving colonial territories.

events.title: First Flight of the Space Shuttle Columbia
events.description: NASA's Space Shuttle Columbia was launched on its maiden voyage, becoming the first reusable spacecraft to carry humans into orbit.
events.significance: Represented a breakthrough in space technology with reusable launch vehicles.
